website_summaries.verdict: This little handheld marine GPS device is an affordable way to accurately map out waypoints and keep tabs on your exact location on both land and sea.
pros: Preloaded with coastal maps of U.S. and Bahamas
Easy to share map and navigation data with linked devices
cons: It may float, but that doesn’t mean it is completely waterproof

customer_reviews.title: Really accurate but not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I only use it to mark my spearfishing spots. I used to have a Garmin 76CSx. This one worKS similar. I notice this one actually have approximate depth of the places I marked. It's pretty much accurate with the depth. I can't give it 5 stars because I haven't used any other features. The battery compartment is not waterproof. There is no gasket around the compartment. The 76 csx also said it was waterproof, I fpundits out the hard way that the battery compartment is not.
customer_reviews.author: just a guy.

customer_reviews.title: GPSMAP Model 78 a loser
customer_reviews.text: Tried this GPS out. Long time Garmin user auto, marine and hand held. The model 78 and 78sc is a truly terrible device. The screen resolution is bad, the maps detail even zoomed in is deficient. While the options for the unit (compass, elevation, tracking) are excellent the display destroys this unit. Attempting to place the cursor on a waypoint on a bouncing boat is terrible. Sorry Garmin the model 78 is a looser
customer_reviews.author: Howard Conrad

customer_reviews.title: More accurate if you can attach outboard antenna.
customer_reviews.text: Have not seen most recent marine handheld GPS from Garmin, but I love this one! Comes with NOAA chart built in, shows depth, breakwalls, land, etc on screen. Screen is small, but this is a handheld! I use it when I go fishing on other peoples boats, and it takes us to the spot without fail. I also use it in conjunction with Google Earth to locate large pools of water on streams in Colorado that I could not find without a helicopter!! Enter the numbers dd mm ss from Google, then drive/walk following arrow to spot.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen C

customer_reviews.title: Anybody want to trade this lame trinket for a new GPSMAP 76c
customer_reviews.text: Anybody want to trade this lame trinket for a new GPSMAP 76c? It's a huge leap backward. The 76 had a bigger screen and the batteries would last for an entire voyage. This one is tiny, blurry, muddled and even in power conservation mode Ultimate Lithium batteries last a couple hours.
customer_reviews.author: Kekeck

customer_reviews.title: unable to get tracks off the unit
customer_reviews.text: Unlike the previous model (76cx), the 78sc is seemingly unable to store tracks on the micro SD card. My call to Garmin support and the support person's double-checking with "engineering" did not come up with a solution. Very disappointing. Fortunately, I was able to by a used 76cx in excellent condition. I was also so far unable to read the tracks off the unit via USB using Linux. Allegedly it can be done with an application on Windows or OS X. Why can't Garmin adhere to earlier standards? Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: M. Spring

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!
customer_reviews.text: Received error message "unable to load maps" thus you don't get the marine map you need. Almost caused me some serious issues on the water.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not user friendly
customer_reviews.text: things this day and age should not require a 2 week class to learn how to use. I have messed with this thing for a few hrs now. I have learned that the longer I mess with it the more I hate it. im going to give it another couple of tries...if I cant figure it out its going back to amazon. no instructions were included. I downloaded a $15 NAVIONICS app and it took about 15 mins to learn to use it. will update when I get more time to play with this thing.
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: Advertised as super user friendly etc
customer_reviews.text: Going back in the box and getting returned immediately. Advertised as super user friendly etc.....right out of the box error code "cannot unlock maps" according to instructions on Page 3 you should be able to acquire satellites by powering on. Following these exact instructions just generates the same error code over and over again. Some online searching instructs me to get codes and input them. It was supposed to have maps and charts loaded. Off to a bad start with this will try a better brand.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: Garmin automatically downgrading charts
customer_reviews.text: The "Garmin Express" software is now downgrading maps on the 78sc from version 2015.0 to 2012.50. So now instead of having 4 year old charts I have 7 year old charts and no way to revert back to 2015.0. This device is pretty terrible all around (the issues have been covered here in many reviews) and the last thing it needed were even older charts. Avoid this product.
customer_reviews.author: K. Needels

customer_reviews.title: Works great- NOT WATER RESISTANT!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The water resistant rating of this product is totally bogus. I even went as far as gorilla taped the two flaps down in the back that people mentioned were flimsy(they are), and water still entered the device. It is still working, thankfully, but now I'm left with $300 unit that I have to figure out how to modify to make water resistant like it was advertised that it was. Very disappointing for garmin, if it isn't water resistant do not market it like it is.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Lots of features
customer_reviews.text: Its been all over the globe and dropped a few times. I have run it while flying and the data is pretty accurate with what the airline is reporting. Great tool for techies/explorers. I keep it running in the car and it helped me get a speeding ticket dropped after I was able to show I wasn't habitually speeding but only passing a car when I got pulled over.
customer_reviews.author: A News

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: After doing several hours of research I settled on this product and couldn't be happier. Used it a couple times now on the Texas coast for bay fishing and it worked great. My guide even commented how awesome it was. The visuals are great and the product only has a 2 hour learning curve. I was able to plug it into my computer and plot out several points I needed as well. Overall a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Trey W. Welch

customer_reviews.title: Garmin GPS 78 SC Marine handheld
customer_reviews.text: Tessing it at home it seems like a great purchase. I'm going out to Lake Michigan this weekend to give it a real try out on the water. I was able to locate my slip and set it as a waypoint already.
customer_reviews.author: Xk24

customer_reviews.title: GPS Marine
customer_reviews.text: No input for boat parameters to avoid shallow areas Hard to see while boating and in sun.
customer_reviews.author: Kimo

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you get the "SC" or you will be very disappointed. Its useless without the maps
customer_reviews.text: It's expensive but comes with the maps and everything you need. I use it as an emergency backup on the boat. Make sure you get the "SC" or you will be very disappointed. Its useless without the maps.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to master. Needed a lake chip which was an extra $140.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Linowski

customer_reviews.title: YOU NEED A SD CARD
customer_reviews.text: My dad is a seaman in central america. It seems as if its a solid product. He have not used it as yet due to the fact that it did not come with an SD CARD. I did not know that you need an SD card inorder to get it up and running.
customer_reviews.author: Aurelia Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use marked our spots well on water connects with our other garmin gps !
customer_reviews.author: Deedra M

customer_reviews.title: 78SC is a great GPS for all around boat, plane, car navigation.
customer_reviews.text: Lots of options in use, good color, accurate - I could capture up to 12 satellites. Exactly what I wanted for my small boat. Great in the car to keep the passenger busy. Lots of software and hardware options and accessories.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen O'Mara

customer_reviews.title: the 60cs was dang near perfect. You need to do a better job of ...
customer_reviews.text: The position of the buttons relative to the screen is upside down.... Garmin, the 60cs was dang near perfect. You need to do a better job of button control and interface. In today's design market there really isn't an excuse so many designers out there specialize in user interface.
customer_reviews.author: Be Moore

customer_reviews.title: Replacement gps
customer_reviews.text: We replaced our six year old gps of same model with this one. Exactly the same, works great.
customer_reviews.author: ZoeK

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared to spend more money.
customer_reviews.text: I thought that having spent over $200 on this item, that it would be usable out of the box. It was completely useless without purchasing maps from Garmin. Im sure it has alot of potential, but for the price I was highly disappointed. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Wyser

customer_reviews.title: Received product worked great for less than 8 hours over 11 month period
customer_reviews.text: Received product worked great for less than 8 hours over 11 month period. Garmin support over email, They just stall a 10 min process for a week or two of useless emails. Called in the middle of the day several times was told hold time was 30 min. Sorry to say I have spent 5k plus on marine units and will not buy Garmin again!
customer_reviews.author: Jason G

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: good for boating nav., but needs to have a clearer screen in direct sunlite
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: What it takes to get started..
customer_reviews.text: I am so overwhelmed with this product ! I just bought a sailboat (22 ft), and have never used a marine GPS. Having said that,I ‘m very confused and unsure about using it. After a while I hope it gets easier.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Harvey

customer_reviews.title: unit was used
customer_reviews.text: unit was used, had scratches on it, didnt return because i needed it right away on a trip to the keys, but it was sold as new
customer_reviews.author: Andrew B

customer_reviews.title: good solid piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.text: very nice product great for kayaking the salt marshes where you can get turned around. still learning how to use it to its fullest capacity, im not too tech savy. if you are going to use it for anything other than coastline additional software must be purchaced.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: I've had several Garmin products and never been disappointed. The only con is the small screen but ...
customer_reviews.text: A lot for the money. I've had several Garmin products and never been disappointed. The only con is the small screen but I knew that when I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it is a very good product.
customer_reviews.text: The screen is a bit small and it takes some handling on a regular bases to learn how to use it well but other than that, it is a very good product.
customer_reviews.author: MIAMI PSPI, LLC

customer_reviews.title: Works well and screen is better than the old model
customer_reviews.text: Works well and screen is better than the old model. I wish the buttons were on the bottom since I like to keep it in a cupholder. The screen could be a tad bigger as well. Overall good performance and built in maps work well.
customer_reviews.author: BigAl

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong here - unless you want a bigger screen.
customer_reviews.text: I've had a 76 and a 78sc for years. Newer models just get better and easier to use. If I hadn't lost mine, I'd still be using the one I bought 8 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Dale George

customer_reviews.title: Great unit for small/portable applications
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 78sc unit to go on a 60 mile open ocean trip on my jetski, sturdy design, great satellite reception, performed as expected, easy to use, compact for small or portable applications, pre-loaded charts are a plus. Only down side is no sensors included-I think for the price, Garmin should include at least a depth sensor. Also-screen is small and it can be difficult to read charts when at high speeds, but it's a compromise in leu of portability. All in all a good unit for small/portable applications.
customer_reviews.author: mabel salazar

customer_reviews.title: The screen is better than previous models but I wish garmen would put ...
customer_reviews.text: The screen is better than previous models but I wish garmen would put screen on top and buttons on bottom so green is visible when I put it ina holder
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Returned as was difficult to read...did not work for me.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: and recommended returning them
customer_reviews.text: Bought two. Neither worked out of the box. Garmin support couldn't fix problem. and recommended returning them.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Hannegan

customer_reviews.title: Charts are updated and easy to read
customer_reviews.text: This is my backup chart plotter. Impressed by how reliable / precise it is! Charts are updated and easy to read. Easy to program waypoints, lots of useful info (tides and so on....). The whole thing in a easy carry-on unit. A must have to any sailor / boater.
customer_reviews.author: Andy_FL

customer_reviews.title: Not what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: Not at all what I expected. Does not live up to what I was wanting. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS OLDHAM

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not the easiest to use, big learning curve for us
customer_reviews.author: michelle nowak

customer_reviews.title: But after updating the software it works fine..
customer_reviews.text: I also got the CANNOT UNLOCK MAPS ERROR....But after updating the software it works fine...
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: So far so good I have not got a chance to use but it’s exactly what I need
customer_reviews.author: max d smith jr

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This thing tells you how deep the ICW is even at lie tide!
customer_reviews.author: Virginia W.

customer_reviews.title: Bad zooming graphics.
customer_reviews.text: Bad graphics when u zoom in screen becomes to blurry to see. Just missed return due to being sick. Would have returned if I had not been sick.
customer_reviews.author: L. Davis

customer_reviews.title: lots of info
customer_reviews.text: a newbie to this genre, it's taking a little time to figure it all out...only have the online manual to use and need to attach unit to view, so don't like that otherwise has a lot of potential
customer_reviews.author: gary jaeger

customer_reviews.title: Gpsmap78
customer_reviews.text: Very good hand held and backup unit. Works fast acquiring signals and the maps are adequate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The screen is small - just big enough to be ...
customer_reviews.text: The screen is small - just big enough to be workable. The programming is not intuitive for some functions and the documentation isn't much help.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McClintock

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: A very nice backup GPS. That's what we got it for, but I find myself looking at it more than the fancy chartplotter.
customer_reviews.author: Dirk Lummerzheim

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like this small unit...it has many features that I found very , very useful in a GPS.
customer_reviews.author: larry aiken

customer_reviews.title: does what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: It was a little complicated to learn but since I have no experience with GPS There was a learning curve to consider. I use it when my son and I go fishing on the intercostal waterway. Over all, I am happy with it..
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied with Exceptions
customer_reviews.text: For the most part this item has met expectations. Couple of issues or recommendations. 1) Reverse the face - screen on top and buttons on bottom. 2) Software needs some work. If I scroll the cursor over the map to a select GPS coordinate and follow instructions (press enter, press menu; it sometimes gives me the option to set as waypoint and sometimes it does not give that option. It provides water depth in more cases than GPS coordinates on the screen or briefly shows coordinates then jumps to depth. It also sometimes shuts down when you press Enter using the sequence describe here. Again, satisfied overall but these items would make the 78sc more user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: James R.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Useless, and I Am Thankful I Did Not Need ...
customer_reviews.text: (Attempted To) Use Twice, and It Kept Shutting Down, Then Would Not Turn Back On. Tried Again Yesterday, and It Will Not Turn On At All Any More. Absolutely Useless, and I Am Thankful I Did Not Need it To Actually Navigate Anywhere. Don't Waste Your Money
customer_reviews.author: Scott Berry

customer_reviews.title: I just returned this purchase for provides less than substandard ...
customer_reviews.text: I just returned this purchase for provides less than substandard performance: battery life is less than 24 hours of contiguous use, the display is simply too small, button feedback is way too soft and ambiguous, and the map gets locked up way too many times. Garmin Prod Dev and Marketing groups have failed miserably on this one! Do not buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this, it has outstanding performance!
customer_reviews.text: Great performer at a good price. It takes a while to truly understand all of its capability but the unit performs as advertised!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph S. Vislocky

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use... Be aware of the location on where its going to be use because for some parts of the world you might have to buy a map from Garmin... Very easy to hold on your hand, water proof, foats... End of the line... Its a perfect gadget to have in any adventure!
customer_reviews.author: Jose Alejandro Flores

customer_reviews.title: Bought this as a gift for some one, so ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for some one, so I have no personal knowledge as to how it works but the person I gave it to likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Robertito Torres

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product
customer_reviews.text: very detailed and colorful displays, great for the fisherman. Make sure you get lithium batteries, alkalines only last one day.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: good unit but didn't realize so small
customer_reviews.text: Returned, good unit but didn't realize so small. Went with larger unit.
customer_reviews.author: Trapmanxxxx

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Product! Easy to use! Screen is easy to see in the brightest days! Long battery life... Excellent just excellent!
customer_reviews.author: ALASKAN BUM

customer_reviews.title: Very good GPS, can even use it for limited mapping
customer_reviews.text: Very good GPS, can even use it for limited mapping. Nice screen, good interface, has some silly apps, but all in all a good GPS.
customer_reviews.author: jpunjave

customer_reviews.title: How do i claim product defect on this unit? ...
customer_reviews.text: How do i claim product defect on this unit? Bought this last year but couldnt make it to work, finally we have sent the unit to garmin hongkong they say unit is defective.
customer_reviews.author: khaddy

customer_reviews.title: It's a garmin.  That's all that needs to be said.
customer_reviews.text: It's a garmin. That's all that needs to be said.
customer_reviews.author: Randolph Jones

customer_reviews.title: So far I.
customer_reviews.text: So far I.ve only tested it on land hikes and meats my expectations and now ready for fishing to use it on the water
customer_reviews.author: Arvid L Larson

customer_reviews.title: Returning Garmin and using good ole maps that don't need batteries
customer_reviews.text: Did not turn on. Followed directions. Installed batteries. Won't turn on. Replaced batteries with another new set that worked in another device. Will not turn on. Checked battery direction. Won't turn on. Needed short term GPS to work while main unit is being replaced. Here in the Northwest a GPS is important with rocks and fog. Returning Garmin and using good ole maps that don't need batteries.
customer_reviews.author: mango-mama

customer_reviews.title: GPS garmin 76
customer_reviews.text: As a professional mariner with over thirty years of experience I was very disappointed with this unit. I have an older garmin which is more user friendly and an even older Magellan which functions fine. I would not recommend the 76 to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Capt Ron crook

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I am looking for a waterproof GPS that can load ocean charts/maps. Bought this in January and it worked for a week or two then developed a problem such that the device "Cannot Unlock Maps". I called Garmin tech support last month and they said it was a known problem and they would contact me when a fix was available. Still waiting. They still have my $ and it still doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: JessieH

customer_reviews.title: "Cannot Unlock Maps"
customer_reviews.text: Have read other reviews of this unit, as well. "Cannot Unlock Maps" error. Have owned unit < 6 months. Developed this issue and no apparent fix. Unit is dead weight until Garmin can correct. Update: Raising to 2 stars because I was able to get the unit working again by downloading the Garmin Express software and performing a re-installation of the existing map (did not need to purchase a new map for $100). Yet, none of this was made clear via the Garmin support site -- needed to figure out on my own.
customer_reviews.author: j864

customer_reviews.title: Still some things I don't like
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth model 78, and I'm reluctant to highly recommend. In the past, regardless of how much care I took to make sure the battery compartment is dried out after use, including occasional light immersion (which Garmin claims is protected), the battery springs and contacts rust out, and can't be replaced. In addition, in this most recent model, I don't like the chart that's included: it shows water as brown, and land as blue, which seems silly; and doesn't put place names on islands, etc. Now I'll have to pay additional $$ to download a better chart.
customer_reviews.author: Mainemal

customer_reviews.title: If Garmin Express says map is stale, you get a free SD card with fresh maps
customer_reviews.text: Updated to 5 stars When I registered it by plugging it in to USB and garmin express, express said the map was stale and I should buy a 100 dollar map. I was disappointed. I contacted Garmin and they have a new map guarantee. So if garmin express says the maps is stale, make sure you register it, and then email product support
customer_reviews.author: EmiEmc

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed in this product. This was a late 90's/early 2000 flash back. It's like using map quest on a flip phone. So old school. What's the deal? Google maps on your cell phone is way better than this. If you are planning to use this as your main gps/chart plotter on a boat .... don't. I returned it and bought the humminbird helix 7 fish finder that has gps in it and has a bigger screen.
customer_reviews.author: T.H.

customer_reviews.title: Good Handheld GPS PLOTTER
customer_reviews.text: Pros- handheld and uses regular AA batteries. Screen is small but it is a handheld. Keys are at the top which works but a little getting used to. Cons-Not necessarily water proof. Very difficult to find out how to use it due to a lack of documentation. SD card is almost a must and very little internal storage. Need better instructions on using a computer interface.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Faulty device, says Garmin......
customer_reviews.text: Supposedly comes with loaded marine maps. Maps could not be "unlocked". Called Garmin directly. After trying to troubleshoot for an hour, Garmin said it's a device problem and that I should send it back to Garmin, not Amazon, since it may be a problem with the suppliers lot.
customer_reviews.author: D-Ro

customer_reviews.title: Easier to read screen than my old GPS 72
customer_reviews.text: More features and easier to read than my Garmin GPS 72. Appears to be not waterproof for battery and connection rubber flaps. I will use this in a waterproof bag on my sailboat. Battery life seems much longer though have not used it continuously for more than one hour. Estimate used for total 4 hours and battery still has full charge.
customer_reviews.author: Fred251123

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and performs very well
customer_reviews.text: So far we love the ease and simplicity of this unit. Not sure we trust the water-proof aspect with only the rubber flaps protecting sensitive areas on the backside. We plan to protect the device as much as possible while boating but its comforting to know that IF we dropped it in the water, it would survive.
customer_reviews.author: Sherne

customer_reviews.title: Garmin! Flip this unit 180
customer_reviews.text: I love how easy it is to operate. Love that it floats! Love the Maps for ice fishing. Everything is awesome but just one little minor thing 😬. It just feels like it’s upside down when using it. If this unit was flipped 180 deg. It would be perfect! I’d give it 5 stars but just the only fault is that.
customer_reviews.author: James dean Sheldon

customer_reviews.title: Great compact GPS for advantures
customer_reviews.text: I use this GPS for off road motorcycle adventures. I use the GPS for everything from, camping, fishing, hunting, back road exploring to hiking. It has always worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Breiner

customer_reviews.title: Upside down for easy ust.
customer_reviews.text: Replaces a dead Lowrance H2O. Just got it today. Whoever decided to put the controls at the top and the screen at the bottom clearly never contemplated that anyone would use it with one hand while steering a sailboat with the other. Not sure that I am going to keep it. Own several other Garmin products and like them.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Raleigh

customer_reviews.title: Reliable navigation
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one when my Garmin 76CXs went in for repairs. Reliable units that have served me well on many auto trips and in the woods or on the water. Loading waypoints, routes and such through the Base Camp program on my laptop worked great. It doesn't talk to you like the other auto dedicated units do. But it does have a search function that works and will chart your route for you. I never leave home on any trip without this unit and my original one. And with the right cable, they will enable you to geolog your photos by connecting to the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Cowden

customer_reviews.title: Excellent! A great unit
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! A great unit, easy to carry and use. I picked up a Gizzmovest case for it, and a neck lanyard, so it is easily accessible.
customer_reviews.author: David Koot

customer_reviews.title: very useful product
customer_reviews.text: this marine GPS unit is a perfect size for carrying around to different boats, screen is great and the charts included are amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Eric A.

customer_reviews.title: Great GPS but it does not come with lake maps ...
customer_reviews.text: Great GPS but it does not come with lake maps for your local lakes. I like in MN, so I use it for ice fishing and need the lake maps. Lake maps cost 100$ to download on to a SD card.
customer_reviews.author: L. Khounedaleth

customer_reviews.title: garmen  could do better
customer_reviews.text: A little complicated and could only get a direct line to my waypoints on water. Probably user error but not for me. Water levels and location accurate
customer_reviews.author: Brute

customer_reviews.title: Good for jet ski
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the money. Batteries seem to last awhile so far.
customer_reviews.author: Laney28

customer_reviews.title: Screen Failure
customer_reviews.text: After 1 year of intermittent use the screen failed, lines through it, screen unreadable. I would not recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Alan H.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate. Use it for my boat to locate reefs. Works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best GPS i have so far
customer_reviews.text: Best GPS i have so far. Screen is bit small when at sea but it is a handheld after all
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great for on the lake or the sea, do slot of jet skiing and fishing
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Vardeman

customer_reviews.title: It's a really good chartplotter especially for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is my backup GPS. It's a really good chartplotter especially for the money.
customer_reviews.author: James Minardi

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Added US LakeVu HD for use on ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Added US LakeVu HD for use on my kayak
customer_reviews.author: DJCTop Contributor: Fishing

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sailing companion
customer_reviews.text: I am still learning about the many features but it is already a great tool for my sailing adventures. I also purchased the heavy duty marine case from gizzmovest so I don't need to be too concerned with it banging around during heavy weather.
customer_reviews.author: Sabine

customer_reviews.title: Excellent piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: Excellent piece of equipment. I use it for kayaking, and as a backup unit for offshore fishing. Also small enough to hide in your bag or pocket when you are on someone else's boat fishing their 'secret spots' (shhhhh!). I have 'Insight Planner' which is software for managing my boat's Simrad Chartplotter, and this device easily shares data via the standard format...I can create waypoints and routes on the laptop and load them onto this Garmin handheld. I can also save the tracks and waypoint data from the Garmin to the laptop software.....very easy way to manage data. The Geocaching feature is a great activity for my kids. I am amazed how many caches there are~
customer_reviews.author: Donald S. Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great portable GPS
customer_reviews.text: Great portable GPS. Use it on my boat. This is my second. Tip: if you use the DC power cord most of the time versus batteries be sure to take the batteries out so they don't leak and destroy the device.
customer_reviews.author: Dan P McGee

customer_reviews.title: Arrived promptly, used it right away, plotted our ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived promptly, used it right away, plotted our fishing spots can't wait to take it on our next long hike!
customer_reviews.author: jr

customer_reviews.title: Good value on a gps
customer_reviews.text: Works great, easy to use. This marine gps is excellent. Great value on a dedicated gps unit
customer_reviews.author: Richard Wall

customer_reviews.title: Used for sailing in the BVI
customer_reviews.text: We got this unit in combination with the Garmin BlueChart g2 Southeast Caribbean Saltwater Map microSD Card. It tracked our moves perfectly well, which made planning our day very easy. The GPS was attached to the helm of our charter boat with the use of a Ram Mount Suction Cup Base for the Garmin. This kept everything in place and within easy reach when navigating. We also used the GPS to monitor our anchoring, which was very helpful. The GPS is light weight. The screen was very easy readible, even though the sun was shinging every day. Still need to read the full manual. We just used the device as plug and play and everything worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: The product description is not clear at all. The ...
customer_reviews.text: The product description is not clear at all. The 78s "Compass, Barometric Altimeter" is VERY different from the "Maps, Compass, Barometric Altimeter" version. The 78s is 50 dollars cheaper but this "Marine GPS" comes NO marine charts, Just a very rudimentary base map with no water charting. To actually get a marine chart, those must be purchased separately as microSD cards for $150. Then the card is locked to that device and can not be re-used.
customer_reviews.author: Karl J Meissner

customer_reviews.title: Very happy I bought this model.
customer_reviews.text: This unit served all my needs well. I used it from my kayak to plot uncharted rocks in Southeast Alaska. The unit is sturdy and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: juneau803

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: Good chart plotter but not as any features as the older black and white version. Road display, where you can follow a track, is gone. Also, can not display data fields while in Map mode as before. Couldn't find the tides calculator either. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo R Fernandez Jr

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit, easy to use but only good in ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice unit, easy to use but only good in salt water and or immediate coast. Useless for anything inland unless you purchase a add-on which is very expensive. Google Maps on a cell phone works better in that situation.
customer_reviews.author: M. Robino

customer_reviews.title: Ended up using the garmin software on an iphone and that worked way better for way less money
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a day in Alaska. Ended up using the garmin software on an iphone and that worked way better for way less money.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Dobbs

customer_reviews.title: This unit does everything I need for exploring the Chesapeake ...
customer_reviews.text: This unit does everything I need for exploring the Chesapeake bay on my sailboat. One reviewer said it lacked Highway view, I believe this is renamed to Automotive Mode. I've attached a screen capture of this mode.
customer_reviews.author: S. Pretti

customer_reviews.title: but would be great in these days to have an intuitive and easy
customer_reviews.text: very antiquated user interface.... probably the gps is accurate, but would be great in these days to have an intuitive and easy GUI
customer_reviews.author: M. C. Bell

product_meta.title: Garmin GPSMAP 78sc Waterproof Marine GPS and Chartplotter
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Size:2.6 inchesFeaturing a bright 2.6-Inch LCD color display with built-in basemap and high-sensitivity GPS receiver, the GPSMAP 78 series takes recreational navigation to a whole new level. All three models are waterproof, and include a built-in microSD card slot for loading additional maps and a dedicated MOB (man over board) button.
feature_bullets: Marine-friendly handheld with high-sensitivity GPS receiver and 2.6-inch color TFT display
Perfect for boating/watersports--waterproof to IPX7 standards; floats in water
Built-in BlueChart g2 U.S./Bahamas coastal charts with shorelines, depth contours, navaids, harbors, marinas, and more
Built-in 3-axis tilt-compensated electronic compass and barometric altimeter for heading/altitude/weather
Share your waypoints, tracks, routes and geocaches wirelessly with other compatible device user

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars262 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
